ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Building a solid foundational understanding of Italian.
I learned a lot of vocabulary, tenses, and grammar as well as gaining some confidence and fluency speaking.
learning a new language without any prior knowledge

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The coursework was very manageable. However, I was very rushed to finish each exam and often felt like I did not have enough time. If I had 5-10 more minutes to check over things and look for mistakes, I feel my grades would have been much better.
I wish there was more work individually with speaking fluently that wasn't graded.
The Professor was very encouraging and made sure that the classes were interesting.
I wish the grading was more transparent, especially for the participation and oral grades
course was good for learning italian

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend this course to anyone wanting to learn a foreign language. I felt supported and engaged the whole time.
I would recommend this class to any student who wants to learn a romance language because of the immersion method.
Yes I would definitely recommend it
yes i feel like i learned a lot
